page.title: 06RELIGION METHODIST
page.content: THERE HAS BEEN A METHODIST CHURCH IN WEST TANFIELD FOR 250yrs.IT WAS FOUNDED AFTER VISITS BY JOHN WESLEY. THE PRESENT CHAPEL IS NOW PART OF THE CIRCUIT OF RIPON AND MASHAM IN WHICH THERE ARE THREE MINISTERS AND 23 LOCAL PREACHERS.SERVICES ARE HELD ON SUNDAY AT 10.30am.AND 6.30pm.IF AN ORDAINDED MINISTER DOES NOT TAKE THE SERVICE IT IS TAKEN BY A LOCAL PREACHER.THE OTHER MEETINGS THAT ARE HELD ARE THE FRIDAY FELLOWSHIP,A HOUSE FELLOWSHIP ONCE A MONTH,WOMANS'S GUILD, WOMANS MEETING AND SUNDAY SCHOOL.THE AVERAGE SUNDAY SERVICE ATTENDANCES ARE-MORNING SERVICES 30/50,EVENING SERVICES 14/20.THE REV.M STATON WOULD LIKE TO SEE CLOSER CO-OPERATION BETWEEN THE ANGLICANS AND METHODISTS, BUT FELT THE TWO CHURCHES WOULD NEVER UNITE. .
